newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Detained Palestinian journalist on hunger strike.
newsitem.headline: Detained Palestinian journalist on hunger strike.

text.p: Detained Palestinian journalist Daoud Kuttab went on a hunger strike on Friday demanding he be freed or charged by the Palestinian Authority, a Palestinian human rights group said.
The Palestinian Centre for Democracy and Elections (PCDE) said Kuttab, who was taken into custody on Wednesday, was being denied visitation rights.
"Mr Kuttab announced at 11.45 a.m. this morning that he had started a hunger strike that will continue until he is released from prison, or charges are brought against him," it said in a statement.
"The PCDE strongly condemns the order made by the office of the President (Yasser Arafat) of the Palestinian Authority to deny visitation rights to...Kuttab," the statement said.
It called for Kuttab to be immediately released or charged.

Kuttab's brother told Reuters on Wednesday that Kuttab was summoned to Ramallah by Palestinian police. The journalist, who holds U.S. citizenship and lives in East Jerusalem, went to the Ramallah self-rule enclave in the West Bank and was detained.
The United States said on Thursday that Kuttab should be released and that the matter had been raised with senior members of the Palestinian Authority but not directly with Arafat.

Kuttab's brother said the detention was apparently related to a dispute between Kuttab, who has a private contract to carry live broadcasts of Palestinian Legislative Council session, and Palestinian state-run television.
